title: Sri Lankans in Israel asked to be vigilant after US attacks on Iran
byline: Sri Lankan Ambassador in Israel Nimal Bandara has requested the Sri Lankan expatriates to be vigilant and follow safety instructions issued by the Israeli government following missile attacks by Iran in the Northen and Central parts of Israel last morning.

title: Sri Lanka to turn to Nigeria for fuel imports amid global uncertainty
byline: In the midst of escalation of tension in the Middle-East and concerns over further disruption in fuel supply chain , Sri Lanka has decided to explore the possibility of importing petroleum products from Nigeria, an official said yesterday.

title: SLTDA unlocks 3,000 acres for tourism development via new digital land bank
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism sector is set for a major investment drive with the launch of the ‘Land Bank Management Information System (LBMIS)’, an automated platform making over 3,000 acres of state and privately-owned land available for development.

title: Central Bank sounds alarm on misleading overseas property investment ads
byline: The Central Bank (CB) has issued a stern warning to the public regarding advertisements promoting investments in overseas real estate, cautioning against potentially misleading claims and illegal financial arrangements.

title: U.S. issues ‘worldwide caution’ security alert
byline: The U.S. Department of State issued a Worldwide Caution Security Alert on Sunday, advising American citizens overseas to exercise increased caution due to escalating instability in the Middle East following intensifying conflict between Israel and Iran.

title: Drug shortage puts medical professionals in quandary
byline: In the wake of Daily Mirror’s reports on the prevailing shortage of critical drugs, medical specialists have raised serious concerns over the lack of clear directives from the Ministry of Health regarding how doctors should act when essential medical items are not available within the public health system.

title: Traffic disruptions due to dense fog in the central hills
byline: Traffic disruptions have occurred in the water catchment  areas on the western slopes of the Central Hills since the early hours of the morning of (23).

title: Doctors’ Union calls for full probe into drug scandal under ex-health minister
byline: The Doctors’ Trade Union Alliance for Medical and Civil Rights is calling for a full investigation into all officials involved in the substandard drug scandal that happened during the time of former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella.

title: Suicide bombing at Damascus church kills 22, Syrian authorities say
byline: At least 22 people have been killed and 63 others wounded in a suicide bomb attack at a church in Damascus, Syria’s health ministry has said.

title: Russia and China push for a ceasefire as UN Security Council meets on Iran
byline: The UN Security Council met on Sunday to discuss US strikes on Iran’s nuclear sites as Russia, China and Pakistan proposed the 15-member body adopt a resolution calling for an immediate and unconditional ceasefire in the Middle East.

title: Iran vows payback for US strikes but leaves diplomacy door open
byline: Iran has vowed to respond to US strikes on its nuclear sites but signalled on Sunday it is not shutting the door on diplomacy.

title: Airlines keep avoiding Middle East airspace after US attack on Iran
byline: Airlines continued to avoid large parts of the Middle East on Sunday after U.S. strikes on Iranian nuclear sites, according to flight tracking website FlightRadar24, with traffic already skirting airspace in the region due to recent missile exchanges.

title: Two tonnes of heroin, ICE seized within five months: Minister
byline: Nearly two tonnes of heroin and ICE (Crystal methamphetamine) drugs have been taken into custody by the law enforcement authorities during the last five months, Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said today.

title: Arrest warrant issued against Sajin de Vass Gunawardena
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Pavithra Sanjeewani Pathiraja today issued an arrest warrant against former Parliamentarian Sajin de Vass Gunawardena for failing to appear in court in connection with a case filed by the Commissioner General of Inland Revenue over unpaid income tax amounting to Rs. 36.9 million.

title: Harshana Suriyapperuma appointed Secretary to Finance Ministry
byline: Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma has been appointed as the new Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, filling the vacancy created by the recent resignation of Mahinda Siriwardana.

title: SJB secures Hambantota Municipal Council
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) managed to secure the administration of the Hambantota Municipal Council, the office of party leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: Sri Lanka calls upon all parties to take concrete steps to de-escalate situation in Middle East
byline: Sri Lanka has called upon all parties to take concrete steps to de-escalate the situation in the Middle East region, claiming that Sri Lanka is gravely concerned about the latest developments in the Middle East.

title: TISL files Supreme Court challenge against Companies (Amendment) Bill
byline: The Transparency International Sri Lanka (TISL) has filed legal action in the Supreme Court challenging the proposed Bill to amend the Companies Act No. 07 of 2007, citing serious concerns over the transparency and effectiveness of its provisions on beneficial ownership disclosure.

title: Iran’s supreme leader asks Putin to do more after US strikes
byline: Iran’s supreme leader sent his foreign minister to Moscow on Monday to ask President Vladimir Putin for more help from Russia after the biggest U.S. military action against the Islamic Republic since the 1979 revolution over the weekend.

title: Over 1.6 Mn drug tablets confiscated so far
byline: Over 1.6 million drug tablets have been confiscated so far as Sri Lankan authorities ramp up a comprehensive national programme aimed at preventing drug use and supporting recovery efforts islandwide, according to the Government Information Department.

title: Sri Lanka grants access to FAO research vessel
byline: Sri Lanka has granted clearance for a research vessel operated by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) to conduct studies in the country’s waters from August 15 to 20, 2025, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism said.

title: Nissanka Senadhipathi leaves Bribery Commission
byline: Chairman of Avant Garde Maritime Services, Nissanka Senadhipathi, appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) today (23).

title: Plate printing halt hits 15,000 vehicles
byline: The disruption in license plate printing has resulted in a backlog of approximately 15,000 vehicles awaiting number plates since May 1 this year, according to the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT).

title: US asks China to stop Iran from closing Strait of Hormuz
byline: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has called on China to prevent Iran from closing the Strait of Hormuz, one of the world’s most important shipping routes.

title: Big names return as Bangladesh reveal ODI squad for Sri Lanka
byline: A host of key players have been named as Bangladesh announced a strong squad for their upcoming three-match ODI series against Sri Lanka.

title: Prison officials meet Justice Minister
byline: Minister of Justice and National Integration, Harshana Nanayakkara convened a special discussion this morning with Prison Commissioners and all prison superintendents islandwide at the Ministry of Justice.

title: US Embassy in India mandates public social media for visa applicants
byline: The U.S. Embassy in India has announced that, effective immediately, all individuals applying for F, M, or J nonimmigrant visas must set their social media accounts to public as part of the vetting process required under U.S. immigration law.

title: UN Chief to discuss Human Rights issues, impact of economic crisis: United Nations
byline: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Türk will meet government, religious leaders, victims, civil society, UN representatives and diplomats during his visit in Sri Lanka.

title: Call national security council meeting to discuss Middle East crisis: Sajith tells Govt.
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today urged the government to call for an urgent meeting of the national security council to assess the risks that Sri Lanka has to face when it comes to the conflict in the Middle East.

title: UN High Commissioner for Human Rights arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, Volker Türk arrived in Sri Lanka this afternoon for a four-day official visit.

title: CSE declines sharply as Middle East tensions worsen
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed on a negative note today, recording a significant decline from the start of the trading session, as both the ASPI and S&P SL20 indices fell sharply. The downturn was primarily driven by escalating geopolitical tensions between Iran and Israel, which continue to deteriorate. Investor sentiment remains highly cautious, particularly amid growing concerns over U.S. involvement in the conflict.

title: Police warn against misusing Police Emergency Hotline 119
byline: Steps have been initiated to take legal action against those who misuse the 119 hotline service by making false complaints, which minimises the accessibility to the Police Hotline 119 in an emergency situation, the Police Media Division said.

title: Court of Appeal stays Wanathawilluwa Pradeshiya Sabha inaugural meeting
byline: The Court of Appeal today issued an interim order suspending the inaugural meeting of the Wanathawilluwa Pradeshiya Sabha, which was scheduled to be held tomorrow (24).

title: UAE airspace is closed based on flight paths and air traffic control audio
byline: United Arab Emirates airspace is currently closed based on flight paths and air traffic control audio, according to a post by FlightRadar on X.

title: Iran says missile attack matched number of US bombs
byline: Iran said its missile attack on Al Udeid air base in Qatar matched the number of bombs dropped by the United States on Iranian nuclear sites this weekend, signaling Iran’s likely desire to deescalate.

title: Qatar condemns Iranian attack on US base and says missiles were intercepted
byline: Qatar has condemned Iran’s attack on the Al Udeid air base and said that “Qatar reserves the right to respond directly in a manner equivalent with the nature and scale of this brazen aggression, in line with international law”.

title: Iran attacks US forces at Qatar air base as missiles launched at US base in Iraq
byline: Iran has claimed responsibility for an attack on American forces stationed at the Al Udeid air base in Qatar, one of the largest U.S. military installations in the Middle East.

title: Sri Lankan workers in Israel seek to return home due to conflict
byline: An increasing number of Sri Lankan expatriates in Israel are choosing to return home as some of them have lost their livelihood due to the escalating conflict in the Middle East, according to Sri Lanka’s Ambassador in Tel Aviv Nimal Bandara.

title: Several explosions heard over Qatar capital Doha, Reuters witness says
byline: Sounds of several explosions were heard over Qatari capital Doha, a Reuters witness said on Monday, following Tehran’s threats to retaliate against the U.S.’s strikes on Iranian nuclear sites.

title: Qatar closes airspace as UK and US tell citizens to shelter in place
byline: Qatar has temporarily closed its airspace after the US and the UK told their citizens in the country to shelter in place ’’until further notice’’.

title: Flydubai celebrates 15 years of service to Sri Lanka
byline: Flydubai marked a significant milestone this week, celebrating 15 years of continuous service to Sri Lanka. Since commencing operations, the airline has played a vital role in connecting Sri Lanka to the world, offering travellers reliable and memorable journeys.

title: Sri Lanka pacer ruled out of the second Bangladesh Test
byline: The hosts will be eyeing to clinch their opening series in the ICC World Test Championship 2025-27 cycle with all to play for in the series decider.

title: Venerable Udaeriyagama Dhammajiva Thero honoured at National Piriven Day ceremony
byline: Venerable Udaeriyagama Dhammajiva Maha Thero, the founder of Sati Pasala and Universal Mindful Village, and the Chief Incumbent of Nissarana Vanaya Meethirigala Forest Monastery, was felicitated during the recent National Piriven Day ceremony held at Temple Trees, the official residence of the Prime Minister.
